Question: What Does My Policy Cover If I Get into an Accident?
Answer: Your car insurance policy covers liability for injuries and property damage to others, as well as accidental damage to your car. It also includes personal benefits such as medical expenses, personal accident coverage, and the replacement of child car seats and in-car entertainment equipment. Additionally, you can receive a courtesy car during repairs and have protections like the Uninsured Driver Promise and Vandalism Promise, which safeguard your No Claim Discount under certain conditions. For complete details, refer to sections on liability, accidental damage, and personal benefits in your policy booklet.

Section 1: Liability
Injuries to Other People: Covers injuries or death to others caused by an accident involving your car.
Property Damage: Covers damage to someone else's property.
Section 4: Accidental Damage
Accidental Damage to Your Car: Covers repairs or replacement of your car if it is damaged in an accident.
Child Car Seat Replacement: Covers the cost of replacing a child car seat if it is damaged in an accident.
In-car Entertainment: Covers in-car entertainment equipment that was permanently fitted in your car when it was made.

Personal Accident: Provides financial help if you or your partner are accidentally injured or killed in a car accident involving your car.
Medical Expenses: Covers medical expenses for injuries resulting from an accident.
Hotel Expenses: Covers hotel expenses if you cannot drive your car after an accident.
Personal Belongings: Covers personal belongings if they are lost or damaged by an accident while they are in or on your car.
Uninsured Driver Promise
If you are involved in an accident that is not your fault and the other driver is uninsured, your No Claim Discount will not be affected, and you will not need to pay an excess once the fault is confirmed.

Vandalism Promise
If you claim for damage to your car caused by vandalism, it will not affect your No Claim Discount on the policy.

Courtesy Car
If your car is being repaired by an approved repairer, you will get a courtesy car to keep you mobile while your car is being repaired.

Additional Exclusions and Conditions
Legal Costs: Reasonable legal costs or expenses to defend or represent you in court.
Repairs and Replacements: Detailed information on how repairs and replacements are managed is found in sections 2, 4, and 5 of the policy.
